Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken and waffles

enG9Q5iiDzr5eUfpai2MHw.text: If I could leave a negative star for my dining experience here today I would. I was so excited to try this place based off all of their instagram photos and the fact that they're a gluten free establishment that serves foods I normally wouldn't be able to enjoy unless I prepared it myself. With that said the excitement was very real. We arrived a little after noon and were told it would be a wait of 30 minutes or longer which was to be expected on a Sunday. We were able to get seated 45 minutes later. We ordered our food as soon as our server asked us about drinks. Our food arrived at our table 45 minutes after placing the order. We watched several people who came in after us receive their food first but didn't make a big deal out of it. We were certain the chicken and waffles would be worth the wait. The wait was finally over and we dug in. Our waffles were still wet and undercooked. I had to get up and find the server to let him know because no servers came by to do a quality check. He offered to bring us a new waffle and the new waffle was the exact same as the previous one so it sat there. Now on to the chicken. The breading was the perfect consistency and it came out super hot which is great, however, it disappointed in flavor and lacked seasoning. I was only able to eat one of the three chicken tenders and it was only out of pure hunger. We sat there for an additional ten minutes. Throughout our dining experience we saw several other patrons who were frustrated due to not getting their check and some finally got up and walked over to the pos system to pay. Others were frustrated due to the very long wait. While talking to the diners behind us, they said this was the first time they'd had poor service and were just as dissatisfied. We finally approached our server at the pos while he was closing out a check and let him know that we would be leaving due to the poor service and underwhelming food. He said "I know we gave you bad service today and I can't argue with you about that." He was very understanding but there was hardly any apology or solution given to incentivize us to come back. I served at one of DTPHX's most popular restaurants. Quality checks were mandatory within minutes of observing our patrons take their first bites. If a customer was dissatisfied we'd immediately apologize and offer to remake it and remove it from their bill. If that wasn't satisfactory we'd give them coupons for a discount on their next bill, free drinks or free dessert. Hell sometimes we'd give them several coupons. Regardless of whether the offer would be accepted we'd try our best to accommodate them for the inconvenience. Dirty plates never sat on the table for long and we dropped checks as soon as their plates were collected. I observed none of this at Jewel's today. I think the concept at Jewel's is great but the execution is severely lacking. I saw no FOH manager floating around and it seemed like the servers were just running around with no real order or direction. The restaurant itself also wasn't up to my high standards. There are holes in the ladies bathroom walls, an empty to go container sat outside on the patio floor the whole time we were there and the floor and tables weren't clean to the standard I would expect for any restaurant. Perhaps my expectations are too high having had worked in restaurants before but I'm sorry Jewel's you guys really missed the mark for us today. My suggestion would be to coach servers on how to be more communicative and transparent when there are longer ticket times, bump up the efficiency by streamlining service better (full hands out and full hands in so tables get cleared faster), be more attentive to patrons and do quality checks. Also having a FOH manager present would certainly help too, especially for handling dissatisfied customers. Like I said, I really like the idea and I think this place has a lot of potential, maybe today was just an off day, an anomaly if you will. I'd like to say I'd give them another chance but I think that would be a lie.

D9DVyN6nV9Mzk_o068rJPA.text: We had a 14 group reservation and upon arriving they told us they weren't seating anymore people and that their kitchen was extremely backed up. When inquiring about the fact that we had a reservation they eventually told us that another large group took our reservation by claiming to be us and that we would have to wait over 30 Mins to be reseated.  We called Ocotillo who accommodated us immediately. Safe to say I won't be back to Jewels.

xJzn8dEPakHPBULT6n0Lbg.text: I would have probably enjoyed this place if they honored our reservation and didn't give it away to another party. I called earlier in the week to make reservations for my group which included 7 out of town guests. It was supposed to be a special brunch celebrating our out of town guests and also a goodbye brunch for a friend. A few people in our party  arrived and were told that the restaurant was not seating anyone right now even though we had a reservation.  After that was communicated to us they then told us our reservation was taken by another group. They couldn't guarantee a time frame for our party to be seated and no intentions of accommodating us. It was very difficult to relocate my party of 14 on Sunday because of this restaurant's blunder. Overall I was very disappointed with the lack of customer service.

68MI0_m7MzNBcciz32QdiA.text: This place is heaven for people looking to enjoy things they previously have been unable to sue to gluten! My husband was amazed (he is not gluten free) and said he couldn't even taste the difference! Jewel's is breaking the stigma that all gluten free food tastes like garbage. We ordered the Hot chicken waffle sandwich, green Chile cheese curds and the popcorn chicken and donuts. So delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-z6ENXRGk7kuKtRzu-ip1Q.text: Whenever I am nearby, I try to go to Jewels.  I love that I can come here and not worry about cross contamination.  I can hardly ever contain myself and usually have all the bread products I can.  I had the maple bacon French toast for Mothers Day and it was delightful.  Sandwiches are amazing.  The smothered chicken and biscuits are heavenly, the fried chicken and waffles are a thing of dreams (you don't dream of chicken and waffles?  You must not have celiac!)  My gluten eaters also like the food, so that's saying something!

K0vWWRM460DM90z-I4S1iQ.text: The pancakes were amazing! The service could be a touch more attentive, but it won't keep me from coming back the next time I'm in town.

9McAa8u_GboJx8Pmtt6Qiw.text: I came all the way from NYC and my family members made reservations for a big party (14 people). However they gave our reservation away!! Very poor customer service.

Db1BKbQTpQYrlBTmZfwNXw.text: Best gluten free in town! Jewels cafe does an amazing job at combining favors. You MUST have the chicken and waffles.

OOP8IP16D-CJsiMLBdQlVQ.text: A neighborhood favorite. My husband is celiac and It is such a treat for him to go to a restaurant and not have to think about what he orders. The chicken and waffles is a personal favorite! They also have fun holiday events like gluten free gingerbread house making. We love it!

CRLyFMnaRLvU2OGPbxvepw.text: The food is fantastic!! The service... it seems to be made up of people who have never worked in customer service or the food industry. Inefficient and borderline horrifically rude. They treat you as if they wish you hadn't called in an order or visited their establishment. I will visit a place even if the food is just so-so if the service is phenomenal. Jewel's, PLEASE visit a Dutch Bros and see how they work the service. Be kind at the very least!!! If you hate the job that much then find another job!!!!!! There are TONS of food service jobs!!!!!!!! Kindness isn't that hard!!! *update* There doesn't seem to be a way for me to private message you. It hasn't been one specific server and it's been repeatedly or I wouldn't have left the review. We recently tried again with a call in order and the service was MUCH better. It showed that you had read this and taken it to heart. I am rooting for you SO hard!!! Gluten free life can totally suck and your food makes eating almost normal again. Thank you  We will continue to keep giving it a shot because the food is delicious and the gluten free community needs you.

VH40iL2wwd8R5lTXdbnu_Q.text: Wonderful experience from start to finish! We were seated and brought waters immediately, our server was over within 5 minutes and the food came out quickly and delicious! Even though they were very busy and it was a Sunday afternoon, the service was prompt and friendly. My husband has celiacs disease so this place is a total treat! We will be back again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZxtfUDC865RBoNJw5GMLRA.text: Very impressed! Coffee was delicious, staff was delightful, patio seating was refreshing. Overall, great experience. The pancakes were to die for and their syrup really made the dish. The chorizo bowl was very flavorful and perfectly put together. The atmosphere has a very clean relaxed feel. I definitely plan to come back next time I'm in Phoenix!

rdLb-nDcFKotx4vIib6O_A.text: Jewel's Bakery & Cafe is an excellent addition to this East Phoenix neighborhood. We enjoyed a lunch of both their sandwich specials for the day: Pesto Chicken & Balsamic Portobello. Each sandwich came on a different gluten free roll that were equally tasty, the chicken was super juicy, the portobello was roasted with just the right amount of tang, and everything was definitely homemade.   We were too full to try any of the baked goods, which include awesome-looking cupcakes, sticky buns, scones & cookies. But I will definitely be back to try those gluten free creations, as well as their quiche for breakfast/brunch.  All the staff was super friendly and efficient. As we settled into the cozy cafe, Julie, the Jewel's behind the cafe's name, stopped by to check on us! You can't get better than that!  Possibly the best part, as we left, my boyfriend who suffers from a gluten allergy, smiled and said he didn't feel any discomfort at all. A sandwich any where else normally means lots of heartburn medicine. We are thrilled to have found Jewel's Bakery & Cafe and can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pesto chicken sandwich!

y-t6tmDw3_x4zDVk-xZxBQ.text: How do I love thee? Let me count the ways! We live in Vegas but come to Phx about 2-5 times per year. Jewels is on our list of "musts" for each trip. It is so wonderful to be able to eat with reckless abandon and not worry about reactions the entire time we are eating. My 3 year old always gets a cupcake. The pizza is excellent. Cookies are TDF. Donuts are lacking (I think cake donuts would be better than the standard yeast variety. They always taste stale and dry) Chicken and waffles or just plain old waffles are both a must. My gluten-eating husband even likes the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pumpkin Mini Loaf (vegan/gf)

7nnL89Eg2JbgcQQjuZ9lNQ.text: Love, love, love  this place!! My sister and I come at least once a week, more if we can! The cauliflower bites, waffle with shredded pork and the chicken shawarma are downright amazing dishes. We refer everyone at work with a gluten allergy to stop by and check it out. We never leave disappointed!

GUaRV_5NXn-U23p1t-n_Yw.text: Food was good,  but very pricy.  They didn't have any colds brew coffee and the staff was less than nice.  Not sure if I would call out a cafe, we had to be seated.

vPKmv5nHFiA_tioUbQxgvg.text: LOVE the fact that this ENTIRE restaurant is GLUTEN FREE!  I walked in the door and I was greeted by a glass case of delicious desserts and just before the drool ran down my cheek the cashier asked me what I liked...I let out a sigh and said "so what are your gluten free options"? "EVERYTHING!" she said.  My day was made.  I enjoyed a ridiculously fantastic chicken & waffles.  I bought a bag of flour AND pancake/waffle mix.  Got pulled over in the airport by TSA for the questionable items into suitcase (just flour!).  But it was an amazing experience.  YAY for Jewels!

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken and Waffles! GLUTEN-FREE!
Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Magic Bar!

5GoO0RnHWL1AUc-m7dk9kQ.text: Had an amazing kale and bacon quiche for brunch with crispy potatoes.  YUM!  I am stuffed and I am already hoping that they have this next Sunday. Comfy and casual cafe, great location.

6a2AxktfgFkxAOonMceaJA.text: I have to eat gluten free by disease so when a whole restaurant and bakery is guten free I can just go in and order anything!  Now, that is pretty rare for me!  I usually have to involve the chef or manager to ask about cross contamination or how something is prepared.  At Jewel's?  The work is all done for me!  Where else can you get organic, gluten free options like build your own burger, Chicken and Waffles, Pancakes, Grilled Cheese, brownies, Cartel Coffee and more?  The daily specials are scrumptious and keep me coming back time and again.  I have been a customer of Julie's since she baked out of her house and I am so happy to see this great place appealing to so many gluten free diners as well as people who have no idea this is a totally gluten free environment.  Her food is just that good!  I buy my bread there as well.  The flaxbread I can have freshly sliced and it tastes amazing!  It's so good that my daughter requests it and she's not even gluten free!  Cookies and scones are terrific as well and this is my GO TO birthday cake and cupcake store as well.  I had a Monte Cristo donut for National Donut Day that knocked my socks off!  It was nitrate free ham with brie cheese and a cherry sauce in a powdered sugar donut.  Yea, baby!

TdLxLIFuXOPKvcmoV6KLIg.text: I got the veggie tacos and they were amazing... I'm talk best tacos I've ever had. My friends didn't like their food much nor the tea or coffee. I liked what I got but it did seem overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggies tacos. Good but small portion. Where&#39;s the salsa?

8SFWfJsnNXRk2SVtZfh5Iw.text: Gluten free or not the food is great. I had the chicken an waffles and the chicken is very tender and the coating very good. I tried the green chili pork tacos. I'm not sure I would order them again, but had good flavor. I also had chunky monkey coffee, I was unsure at first but it was good. Our waiter Conor was very nice and made sure we were taken care of, way above average service. Next time I will get a massive plate of the chicken.

t02jpZTNNy6a6nw2gKgdfg.text: Jewels had three things going for it. Very close to our house, looks cute from the outside, had a fun looking menu....unfortunately they did not have anything else. My husband and I ate there a few weeks ago for lunch on a Sunday. I had the rice bowl, my husband had the gravy dish. Mine was O.K.,  but his was luke warm. Several weeks passed, we thought we'd give it another try, thinking it might have been an off day before. Our second experience was worse than the first. It was busy but about 2/3 full, we waited along time before ordering. My husband asked for a cup of coffee....never came, he had to finally go and find someone to get it. Our food took a long time to come, my grilled Turkey Stack was not crispy, had limp lettuce and was room temp. The fries were also room temp and stuck together. My husband had the Omelet, he asked for silverware, I asked for ketchup.....waited......never came, he finally got up to find some himself. No one ever came by to ask if things were good.  I really wanted to like this place, but it's off of our list.

xTJ1ihgPe6feuhmtWISNAw.text: A old friend had returned to town and so we decided to start up or tradition again of going to a different restaurant every six or eight weeks . . . and this time we chose Jewel's Bakery and Cafe . . . and this place truly is a hidden Jewel.  An eclectic little place with a small menu . . . and a great bakery selection.  I chose the Curry Chicken Salad Sandwich with Fries, an Iced Tea, and we split a Rocky Roads Brownie.  The sandwich was a flavor explosion in my mouth . . . the spices , , , the big chunks of chicken . . . the fries . . . hot and crispy . . . the brownie . . . well lets just say . . . I thought I had died and gone to heaven.  This is a hidden jewel that everyone should try at least once in their lifetime . . . but I know i willl try it again . . . and again . . . and again.

gdnUswmD0VgsYce9ft81KQ.text: Absolutely love this cute little bakery and cafe! I love that I never have to worry about gluten here. Also, Connor is an amazing server! Kudos to Jewels!

l7SBRaC_bA-Jl_aGGTIovA.text: Loved eating at Jewels!! Sometimes, I just need a quiche, and they're not easy to find. But Jewel's has 'em, and they are yummy. I was a little worried about the Feta Cheese, as I don't normally eat Feta, but it was super good. It came with potatoes and an awesome selection of fruit.  I'll be back, thanks Jewels!!!

gPXEIzvSjvCNrLxGTzJgkA.text: Today my fiance and I went their for breakfast and I had accidentally left my wallet on the table. I called to see if someone had picked it up but the owner had said she did not hear of anything. I then went down to the restaurant and talked to the waiter who serves us and said he didn't see a wallet but took my number down.   I then went to the barbershop next door thinking I maybe dropped it in the parking lot. The kind barber said he saw me eating their earlier and told the waiter that I had left a wallet on the table. (The same employee who I questioned). The barber went over the with me to confront the guy who then admitted to his owner that he took it off the table and left it in his apron but it was gone.   Turns out the employee took it home but when I threatened I would have the police come he magically went home and said he accidentally switched aprons and now my wallet appeared. Too bad I'm afraid he copied my credit cards numbers down and had to cancel everyone of them.   I worked in the restaurant industry for many year and I would never think of doing this to someone. The owner was very cooperative and helped resolve the situation quickly.  I hate to always blame an establishment for one bad egg, but it left a sour taste in my mouth this time.  I hope in the future I  can return there with different results!

bWPze6wvfjfADmBfH8TRuQ.text: Went here for breakfast today. Waited in line and got up to the register.   The gal at the register asked what we'd like to order. After telling her our entire order, she forgot everything we said and had to repeat it. Then, she asked for clarification on something. As we answered her, she got sidetracked in another conversation and we had to repeat what we said again. She kept complaining about how distracted she was and "didn't know what was going on in this world". Ordering took 2x longer than it should have.   We proceeded to find a table and were excited for our meal. After waiting about half an hour, we asked for an update on our food. The cooks told us they were just starting it and had a "large backup" even though the restaurant was relatively slow.   After waiting 10 more minutes for our food, our breakfast tacos finally arrived. Except, they were just omelettes. Nothing "taco" about it. We could've gone anywhere for omelettes.   We asked a waitress for a manager, who never showed up.   We finally got up and found the manager ourselves. The manager was understanding, but spoke in a confrontational way and pretty much said "I know there is a problem, but deal with it. The last customer waited 50 minutes for their food, so your wait wasn't even that long."  All in all, we won't be back. Ditsy, clueless cashiers; insane wait time; inaccurate menu descriptions, uncaring owner.

N7pAfPRpOsQPGS3bdB--Dw.text: This is the most incredible gluten free heaven. I only wish that it was in LA so that I could go there all the time!!!  GF or not, the chocolate chip cookie was the absolute best cookie I've ever had in my life. And let me tell you...I cookie.  The eggs Benedict with the thick, orange cashew sauce was decadent, heavy, unique and left me craving it the following day.   The servers are all so friendly and helpful.   The coffee is yummy.  All in all, I lurv this place.  COME HERE!!! Like NOW! YOUR SEARCH HAS ENDED!

9K40DdT_RWajJy3bFIkpIA.text: What a treasure! Everything is gluten-free (and absolutely delicious), the atmosphere is relaxed, friendly, and charming, and the staff were so accommodating and patient with us as we took our sweet time ordering from the lengthy menu. This place is a MUST try whether or not you're gluten-free.

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious gluten-free cinnamon sugar donut... of course we had to make room for this after lunch. So SO good.
Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The BEST gluten-free chicken club sandwich with homemade potato chips. Jewel&#39;s Bakery and Cafe is a real treasure.

QdpJ8VeO0fj4aNhPkqUwZA.text: For sure the best gluten free restaurant I've ever been too. Even if you're not gluten free it has great food. Don't be scared by the word "gluten-free" because basically half the menu is stuff you would eat regularly: great omelettes, parmesan fries, and some good chicken and turkey. But either way the food is great, service is great, drinks great and also the bakery also a great variety and always fresh. Highly recommend not just for people with dietary restrictions but for everyone. ASHLEE WAS GREAT!!!

jJMq1HXkpeHqoE5myj9xKQ.text: Quaint little place, super clean, bright, and friendly staff. In a culture of oversized portions, Jewels hit the spot with the perfect serving size. I had the tomato, mushroom, chicken and cheese omelet and it was very tasty, my wife had the biscuit, egg and sausage sandwich which was also delicious. I would def. return to explore the menu further. They also have a lunch menu, served after 11am.

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Front counter
Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dining area

2PyF-r3jsyBHUvChw6l8jw.text: My go to for delectable tasty treats and coffee.   Yes, when they are busy, expect to wait. It can get crazy busy. If you ever have any issue just tell them, because quality is their standard.  Yes exceptional gluten free.  No worries for cross contamination!

_2F2UBdBHJFPPrP-5XeyDA.text: My boyfriend has celiacs and we have been trying to find a completely gluten free place for so long. We live 30 min away and finally decided to try jewels. I think today may have been an off day. The bottomless mimosas were great but the food wasn't that awesome. Everything lacked seasoning. I got the bacon waffle over easy egg sandwich with hollandaise special. The eggs were fried (no runny yolk) and my first round of hollandaise came out scrambled and hard.  It took about 20 minutes to get a new side of it. When that came out it was completely curdled. I know how to make hollandaise and I was so sad.i pow hollandaise so much.  I ended up just eating the eggs and side potatoes because the waffle was so bland and the hollandaise sucked. The maple syrup was hard also and tasted like lame butterscotch. Our service was so slow, but she did comp us for the mess up and for waiting so long and she did this without us having to complain. My boyfriend had the chicken and waffles and the chicken was good but the batter was sooo bland. We also sat in the corner with flies swarming us the whole time. It was beyond annoying and gross. I truly think today was an off day and I think we'll come back and try it again but today sucked.

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Curdled hollandaise. Second batch after sending the first one back that looked like scrambled eggs
Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Curdled hollandaise

g3zgZGX0f_gt6q0JehB25g.text: Jewel's was my surprise stop of the morning, I was running errands and just happen to see the sign and thought, why not.  I ordered the Biscuits and gravy,  one of my favorite items. They put a spin on theirs with corn bread biscuits and Sage gravy.  I'm not one to try new things easy, but thought let's explore a little.  Well, my first bite was interesting-  next was - WHERE is the flavor . I picked up my menu again and noticed my mistake -   They didn't mention sausage in the gravy- it was just a Sage Gravy!   So I gave myself a one star for not reading to closely, but they get a one star for ruining a great menu item,  and the menu made it sound like it runs out fast-  maybe it's me,  but I found it tasteless and dry. The potatoes were not seasoned at all. The eggs were fluffy, but were cold. I'm thinking they had the items ready and not cooked to order. I got my order literally 3 minutes after I placed it.  The best part of my meal was the milk, except it came in a mason jar -  The service was fast, the waitress was nice, but it lacked the bakery feel, smell, and taste.

1ZDlle5tM9syvtSRkU5Qqw.text: The hot chicken and the waffle sandwich are to die for. Bottomless mimosas are the greatest. Please go here great.

w7vpYHG6IckCTA3vRgnp8Q.text: The service was slow, no welcome in.  Coffee tasted like someone took a sh*t in the water and mixed it around with coffee beans and said "that'll work, they'll love it". The waffles were promising yet doughy in the middle.  Ordered the country fried chicken and would say average at best.  (Chicken itself was good) don't despair! Lots of room for improvement.

VkYchJ6mWrJmgOG6PteJcg.text: This place is incredible! Not only do they have lots of gluten-free and vegan options, but they're actually delicious. I tried the waffle breakfast sandwich and it was bursting with flavor. It included eggs, bacon, sausage and lots of melty havarti cheese, all sandwiched between two waffles, and it comes with a delicious caramel-like buttermilk syrup that is to die for. It also comes with "pots," which are their house potatoes and I don't know what it is about them but they are amazing? I truly am still in shock from this place. I want to go everyday. I also got a chocolate chip scone and a salted caramel brownie for later. They serve Press Coffee which is a yummy local favorite. Additionally, the inside is super cute and they have a nice patio for nice weather. The staff was very friendly and personable and the food came out quickly. Seriously you need to come here! #lfthx

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

T3kdjhr5KrtpX9EpjMFXTQ.text: Looking for a place for breakfast while in Phoenix and I saw Jewels listed as a gluten free place. Since I stay gf I decided to try it.  Oh my gosh. It was delicious. I had biscuits and gravy with eggs and home Fries. The gravy was peppery and thick and full of sausage and bacon. The biscuits were tender and flaky. The eggs were done perfectly. The home fries were fresh and hot. Yum!

3107cC-4buwnTuAHZNWcGg.text: I've been here twice and both times we have had to wait about 20-30 minutes for someone take our order or even give us water. The food is always great, hot when it comes out and delicious so no complaints there.

SFyOzfZGV9vQ2LVr1Km-Pw.text: My absolute "go-to" place in Phoenix for gluten-free baked goods. Everything I've ever had here has been delicious. For those of us with celiac disease, the struggle is real. To be able to eat a doughnut or cinnamon roll and not get sick is a huge, huge deal! It's the only dedicated gluten-free restaurant that I know of in the Valley and I'm grateful for them!

E8jsUnbH0HmrIyYT5Q1nug.text: Worst experience ever.  Waited over an hr to be told that they ran out of biscuits (ordered biscuits and gravy) and told it would be another 15 minutes.  For some reason, they felt it would make sense to bring the eggs that were supposed to be with the biscuits separately.  Waited another 30 minutes, no food.  I look around and see that others have gotten their biscuits and gravy that came way after us.  I asked them to cancel our food order and yet they still charged me for the cold eggs which we left on the food.  Terrible.  Avoid like the plaque.

kcFfjeLJfRkHruQC9UVFHg.text: I was excited to try a new place offering vegetarian food and the fact they understood food allergies and were able to quickly answer my questions was wonderful. I was disappointed, however, by the actual food. I got falafel with rice and veggies. The rice was dry and lacking flavor, the veggies were so oily that it soaked through the rice, and I could not enjoy the texture, nor the flavor of the falafel. I gave them 3 stars for even having food I can eat, the staff was friendly and attentive, the place itself is quite cute and because the scone I got was a saving grace to my meal.

7oNPybRuonGKqsBdUp-7NQ.text: Jewel's bakery is a delight and full of treats you will in most cases not realise are gluten free. Dairy free options are also abundant and friendly staff and management make the whole experience relaxing and enjoyable.

zuCMuMQYIs5mOunZMZfEzg.text: I am in love with this place! Here's the deal, I can eat gluten....but my friend can't. She met me for lunch and took me here and good grief, it was amazing! We ordered and shared the fried chicken sandwich, it was to die for. A co-worker had me pick her up the cauliflower wings and those were like HEAVEN! For real, if eating gluten free food is as tasty as this, I'm ALL IN!  Super cute venue, cook to serve. Awesome GF bakery, try their red velvet cupcakes.  Can't wait to get back there, I highly recommend it.

AhCws6rkCR_L-sDUCtj_rw.text: Smallest sandwich ever and very expensive by the way! I'm so disappointed! I paid $10.89 for a tiny sandwich with only veggies and 2 extra thin slices of avocado. I was asking questions to the cashier (by the way she didn't smile at all), she had to ask a question to the manager. The manager was super rude! I can't believe they treat customers like that! The cashier said my sandwich was going to take 10 minutes. Guess what?! It took longer cause they made a mistake with my order. The cashier brought me the sandwich when it was ready. She didn't say thank you. They don't know anything about customer service! My fries were very salty!   I have been here twice and have had very bad impression about their service both times!

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wrong hours!
Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Here it also has the wrong hours. You even don&#39;t have a sign outside.

xGLGRVYLP-fK8g3q45svDA.text: I am always in search of scrumptious baked goods and desserts, so when I heard about Jewels bakery I had to give it a try. I dragged my brother with me (cause he has a sweet tooth too), and we soon found ourselves staring at the bakery case. Unfortunately, what we expected to be a tough decision due to too many options was really quite an easy one...we didn't order a thing. That's right, not one thing...for multiple reasons: 1. There was no one in the bakery (bad sign) 2. No one came to help us  3. The case was dirty 4. There were only a few baked goodies in the case and none of them looked appetizing or worth the calories.  We were both shocked and disappointed to leave empty handed. When an eatery claims to be a "bakery" I expect to at least have the desire to try one thing in their case, but nothing looked good. Next time I'll take my sweet tooth to LGO, essence, or AJs.

TFQrvwVrAkqTJTqXUR_W0w.text: For May 5th wedding, the parents of bride pre-arranged and agreed to a gluten-free cake. For a lot of important people at the wedding, including the maid of honor, gluten-free was mandatory because of Celiac allergy.  On the wedding day, no cake delivered, and there is no communication from Jewels or answers to calls. Father of bride had to leave the wedding to find a cake. We had to cut a cake from the grocery store, and family members were not able to eat it. The cake portion of the wedding was ruined. Brides parents were stressed calling Jewels and figuring out an alternative. We will always remember the wedding cake fiasco from that special day. Jewels took a special moment from us.

7frB4S-BqjdytNvS5ZmwSg.text: I have no idea in the world how this place has four stars. The food is terrible and the customer service is terrible... just a terrible place to come waste your money. Do yourself a favor and spend your money somewhere worth it I would never ever come here.

VAI8jAilo7cxnnh4_p7_Ng.text: I used to be a regular here. Over the past couple years I've watched the service go downhill. I overheard others saying this as well while we waited for our food. I went for Easter brunch at 2:00 there were about 5 tables left so it wasn't even crowded. We sat there waiting for our biscuits while we watched our server eat them in the back for 10 minutes before we got ours. When she dropped the food off, she never came back to ask how it was. My waffles were completely raw inside. Unfortunately this is the 4th time in a row I've been served raw waffles or donuts there. This time I got extremely sick from them. I contacted them on Instagram with no response. I'm disappointed to see a place I used to love so much go downhill so fast.

gie2ad3Lm1X5xXGfn-zXNw.text: I love Jewels. As a person with celiac it is so great to go in somewhere and sit down, have some tea and a pastry that actually tastes homemade. I always get the best service and the daily specials are always a good idea. These are by far the best gluten free pastries I've ever had.

PWhQEV1Vwo9ou0ylTH2bpw.text: Love trying local eatery's and was drawn to Jewels for the gluten-free options as well as the options to turn a meal into vegan if I preferred...I'm not particularly allergic or vegan but I do like to skip gluten and dairy when I can( just to put that out there) Anyway, I was torn between breakfast and lunch but I went with lunch and tried the Santa Fe bowl. It was the perfect portion and just amount of flavor. Everything in the bowl was delicious! My bf ordered the basic breakfast and the pancakes were so good I almost wanted to order just that on the side after my bowl lol but opted for a dairy-free brownie which after it sat out a few minutes was super rich and soft and you couldn't tell the difference! I definitely will have to try breakfast next time!! #lfthx

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ARTEgtFx_PUrgfzyeUZS-Q.text: We are new to the area and were thrilled to hear about this gluten free bakery. It's about 30 min from our house but I heard it's well worth it. Today is my husbands birthday so I called and placed a custom order for a dozen vanilla cake pops with white chocolate coating.  Unfortunately, there was a miscommunication somewhere and I ended up with chocolate cake pops with chocolate frosting. Not ok especially since neither my husband nor I care for chocolate at all. Total ruin for his birthday; however when I called to discuss this with the bakery, they were very kind and even offered to redo the order and bring it to us. If we hadn't had plans for the rest of the day, I would've taken that opportunity. That was a very wonderful thing for them to offer and I appreciate it.  Fortunately, I bought two vanilla cupcakes while there and the cupcakes will be my husbands birthday cake. Not ideal but it's the best I've got right now.  I will probably try them again solely bc of the great customer service I received but won't do a custom order for awhile. I think they're worth a try.

51hCO5bKYNcrEI8WbqpLEA.text: Disappointed!! first time going here ordered the breakfast special the eggs and the pancake that I had to ask for because they forgot to give it to me were good but the the potatoes and sausage were dry and cold and tasted like they been sitting out all morning. Staff unfriendly also no smiles no greetings.

4EX6bJ3-f8wPE4Ohlq15DQ.text: Wow, cant say enough about the new dinner menu at Jewel's! Just got back into town from a trip and my husband took myself and the kiddos to dinner here...it was awesome!  I highly recommend the French Dip appetizer and the Beef Stroganoff.  We all had something different and there were happy diners all around.  Thank you for expanding into dinner:)

_V6snliK33qHGm2U4l29DA.text: The food was very tasty but the service was poor, our waitress took forever getting to us, have us refills only once and didn't check to make sure we were fine or needed anything, she took forever with the check also, l know that they recently started dinner service and maybe that added to the long wait times.

b6BA9I1d5O3w4efz3vkfBA.text: This sweet little restaurant would almost do better if people ordered at the counter and had pagers for when the food is ready. They could solve the service and staffing issue and just focus on serving their yummy food. Go here, it's worth the wait.

y_49zYslfNc3SaaGNtgGVQ.text: The people who were there are rude. The food is okay but way overpriced. I payed $26 for the same quality I could've gotten at IHOP for like $12. After giving them a second chance, never going back.

k3PO5bGTDnTBSBZ8pTUJeg.text: Awesomeeee! They made this delicious cauliflower and a delicious vegan salad! Thank you! We really enjoyed it :))) more vegan options would be awesome!!!

sglnZAlkjpCT86t8NfUrCg.text: Awesome service, awesome people great food and baked goods. The coffee isn't to Bad either. The decor reminds me of little coffee shops in portland, oregon. My kind of place. I would definitely comeback and recommend this place to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salted Carmel macchiato brownie!! Divine!

ZmKaTs9QcF9tAJGm6MeaZQ.text: I adore this place... and not just because it's close to home! It's a cute and cozy little cafe - so nice and quiet! The workers are all really sweet, and the brunch is pretty freakin' good!  I had the chilaquiles, and they were superb, even to-go. The husband had the bisquits and gravy with chorizo. He wasn't over-wowed by them, but said he'd go back.   We tried a couple of their baked goods: the lemon-blueberry scone was alright. The maple-bacon cinnamon roll is a good idea... but could use some work. Our roll was mostly... well, roll. It needs more glaze, and more filling - it was so bready that it was hard to tell that there was any bacon involved. The winner for us was the blueberry loaf. That was pretty awesome (and I'm a pretty good home baker, so... I don't do baked good compliments often).   I returned later in the week for lunch, and had the Red Chile Chicken salad - it was really good! I wish it was a bigger portion, and I wish it was tossed a little better - all the good stuff was at the bottom and I didn't realize it until I had eaten almost all the greens!!!   The "Cafe" part of the name is kinda misleading - I thought I'd be able to get a latte there. They have Cartel coffee, but no espresso drinks. If I was still a student, I'd be here ALL the time studying!

DfXaTee5OJWnKDbomtnfUw.text: I chose to try out this bakery for my birthday lunch because I'd been given one of their cupcakes before (Almond Joy Cupcake...it was delicious) and heard tons of great things about their lunch menu. So we made the trek from the northwest valley and let me tell you, it was well worth the drive!  First impressions of the cafe: Nice location and really neat decor! Vintage/ Shabby Chic is the closest thing I can think to call it, but it's not so frilly that a guy would feel out of place. Some of the art was done by a local artist and overall it was bright, airy and very, very clean. The staff is AWESOME!!! If I could underline that twice I would, so I'll just say it again..The staff is AWESOME!!!  We ordered the Greek Chicken Salad, the BLT, and Roasted Veggie Flatbread and they were all equally delicious! They forgot to remove an ingredient on my son's sandwich and not only did they apologize and bring us a new sandwhich, they also offered us a complimentary treat for the "trouble"!  Now, these treats are the real reason to drive across town because their cupcakes and brownies are good even by gluten standards! I had the Caramel Macchiato Cupcake and it was delicious but then you can't go wrong with the salted caramel brownies either!  The loose leaf mango orange green tea was just another great component to a very wonderful meal.   We'll be back for sure!

aJRJ44kmh8zi8qMNy5oeKg.text: 3 people here and it took 5 minutes to get service, despite about 5 people behind the counter. The waitress was sarcastic when we only ordered 2 apps and 2 drinks. Definitely won't come back.

rQEMhSKknt-sDHjqwSC3Xg.text: Great little place! I did redeem the yelp free cookie coupon and I haven't eaten it yet, but it looks rather promising! Their bread is fresh and homemade. Here is the breakdown of our order.  Breakfast Parfait This was my selection. I was not prepared for the plain yogurt so that was an unpleasant surprise but once I added a packet of Stevia it was very good. I also had a side of bacon. This was not good for me but only because I enjoy center cut (more meat and less fat) and these were the exact opposite! I don't think there was but a sliver of meat on either piece! So I ended up not eating very much of them and at $3 for two pieces, I was not overly happy about that.   Breakfast Taco This was my husband's selection. My husband said that while his choice did not look too appetizing at first,  it did taste good. He really enjoyed the green salsa. Home potatoes were good and flavored well.

oqQV9FkHsKeH7HrjKvWboQ.text: Was excited to check this place out based on the reviews...maybe I have a different idea of what good food is because this was some of the worst food I've ever had at a restaurant. It was pretty much inedible. I got the blueberry pancake stack with a side of sausage snd a latte. The "sausage" was a homemade patty of ground beef with raisins and other random crap in it. It's was cooked to the point of being pulverized. The pancakes on the other hand were undercooked and gummy tasting and that buttermilk syrup was disgusting. The latte was the only good thing I had there and the pastries in the case looked good. I hate ragging on mom and pop businesses but this was a total fail and waste of money. I will admit that I am not on the gluten free bandwagon but I do know there are plenty of ways to make it taste good, this was not one of them.

OE8kvNSXySux-5h8Y6bvxw.text: This place is phenomenal!! EVERYTHING is gluten free here! Biscuits and gravy! Chicken and waffle !!!! I think I just died and went to heaven! The donut are probably the best thing I've had in my gluten free life! This place is a MUST!

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-yVrkixnFR_UIBwh2VtUvA.text: I have died and gone to gluten free heaven. The chicken and waffles are better than I have even had in the south when I used to eat gluten. It's a good thing I don't live in phoenix because I'd never leave this place.... I think there's actually space on the patio for a tent. Maybe I'll stay and have another cinnamon roll.

3P2W-tzpX7atMl8RDSxeCg.text: Jewel's Bakery is SO GOOD. The chicken waffles is what I always get you need to try it. Even if you're not gluten free you should try it because is THAT good. I'm obsessed. Get a side of ranch and dip the chicken in it. A little expensive but totally worth it!!!

DGK3cCqDAB0B2sfTTpvZQA.text: Excellent gluten free menu! Items that I haven't ever seen before that I could have- took a cinnamon bun to go today!

mj3yDHfPe1QjB_4806YGxA.text: First time visit ... had the chicken and waffles ... truly outstanding!!  Also enjoyed the green chili tacos and the lemon cheesecake square for dessert.  Great friendly service, clean bathrooms ... definitlely will be back!

ZM2eM2VIQR3tJXLm4e9auw.text: This review is for the baked goods. I had the pleasure of buying a pack of 4 cupcakes and boy were they delicious! The cake was moist and the frosting was just the right amount of sweet. Each flavor was unique and scrumptious on its own. If your looking for good quality baked goods, look no further! I can't wait to come here for a sit down meal!  I hope this place stays in business forever!

yMESu4IBFUUzzRb1BdJgbg.text: I'm a big coffee drinker and love trying new coffee shops especially if the word bakery is involved. The coffee is super watered down, I definitely make better coffee at home. The ambience and service is good.

dKlsjdyDPMvKYvh12O9VNw.text: It was okay, very clean, nice atmosphere but the food itself was a little disappointing.

oAs6miUTwPwnOtZDBr6i8g.text: I love that this place is gluten-free and the pastries are so yummy. I can't wait to go back and try more stuff!

vtqeZNRCj3RDavItEenTPg.text: So cute! While I didn't try the food, they had great gluten-free baked goods with a lot of variety. Loved the chocolate chip cookies and the donuts were pretty good too for being gluten-free..

g85SDNh881w7ABiXvBTzfA.text: I've known about their baked goodies for quite some time.  I was so excited when they opened a storefront!   I took a friend there for lunch on Tuesday and she loved it so much that she said Jewel's will be our new hangout spot on Tuesday's.  She can't wait for the holidays to be over (when our kids go back to school) so that we can go again.  I ordered the Greek Chicken Salad Sandwich (delicious), she had the BLT and we shared the blue cheese buffalo chips.  Seriously, make this your new spot.  They are dedicated to being gluten- free (which isn't a dietary restriction for me, but hey, the food is so good!) and will take very good care of you.  Fast- casual atmosphere.  Walk up, place your order and go find a table.

nG24ZlLb4tvn78znPRxptQ.text: Everything was amazing. I mean everything (4 kids and 6 adults). Minus one star for not refilling water jug and a bug that was there for the whole hour right by it.

hqupQhsF3Tb9EzKAyjoPlQ.text: It's all gluten free!!!! You've win my heart with Cartel coffee and a finger vanilla cupcake :)

sNbdUkX3T7j38SRYNuZ6aQ.text: I stopped by Jewel's Bakery and Cafe for a late breakfast today and left with extremely mixed feelings. The food was really wonderful! I'm not a regular gluten-free eater and wasn't even aware that it was their "edge" until after I'd demolished their breakfast platter, which included a great pancake with some of the best syrup I've ever had. However, the staff was pretty terrible. The cashier was apathetic and rude, to the point where I felt uncomfortable. The chef made his way around the restaurant asking people about their meals but ignored our table completely. I'm pretty bewildered by this, but my best guess is because we're in our young twenties. But the joke is on you Chef Brad, because I'm writing my first ever yelp review about your poor service. I might be back because the food was so good and reasonably priced, but I'm really put off by my service experience. I'd recommend take out, if you're willing to offer your patronage.

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Classic Breakfast Platter

le67yL6P6zC8V6WKu5hY0Q.text: I planned a birthday party for my Mother-In-Law's birthday. Unfortunately our friend who was baking the cake had to go into surgery. I needed an equally fabulous cake as the one we had planned to be the centerpiece and Jewels Bakery saved the day. They gave us a beautiful Frita Kahlo inspired cake on short notice that was delicious. Every one at the party said it was stunning and took pictures. Thanks Jewel's Bakery.

warBPjeq2Ae8GkwXRWlzvg.text: The baked goods here are some of the best gluten free treats I've had!  I wish there was a location in Los Angeles!  They lost a star because I have a nut allergy, and neither of the guys behind the counter knew what was in what I was trying to order.  They went and checked only after I made a clear point that I couldn't order or eat until I knew that the food was safe.  I ended up getting a breaded chicken sandwich that was fantastic and their fries were great too! Excellent food! I plan to go back anytime I'm in town.

bvoEdd8La1IBghJ5Ep3fqQ.text: Amazing gluten-free breakfast joint.  A must-go!!  The baked goods are to die for and the specials are a hit (including the chicken and waffles).  It's a great place to bring a group and a sure sign the gluten-free phenomenon is here to stay.

BsFW1NMwAR_nNPVx6gPF3Q.text: We've been waiting for her shop to open. We ran at our first opportunity to visit.  Let's say thee best gluten free desserts we've had. Almond joy cupcake killer good. N the chocolate chip scone is delicious.  Thank you jewel for our gluten free experience.

LbncobytJwhx_vPueZ4aNQ.text: Very fun original cafe. Excellent iced tea and organized counter service. Veggie flatbread was a bit flat (!) for me with a heavy tomatoe sauce.  (It has been eaten up as leftovers in our home, hmm.) Flatbreads can be so flavorful with an olive oil rather than pizza sauce...yep, that's a preference.  Desserts appeared a bit ordinary to me. Admittedly, that may be the appeal here.  I promise to revisit to expand my tastings.

oKiGaQk26VhaP_xO9SG1_g.text: I went with a group from work during lunch.  I had the Black berry tea, Cali Chick sandwich and the chocolate white chocolate chip cookies, ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!

MMuiQHWbcDsbGD2sXw2JNw.text: I was visiting from out of town.  Found this place in a newspaper article online while searching for gluten free bakeries and they were open on Sunday.  The inside was very comfy and they had outside seating.  The entire place is 100% gluten free so I would have come hungry for lunch/brunch if I had known.  They had some vegan items marked and some more they told me about.  Great safe food place!

5JEvM5-FF5rhllFGinnkSQ.text: I finally checked out Jewel's Cafe today and I wanted to cry tears of happiness when I took my first delicious bite of chicken and waffles!  I was diagnosed with Celiac Disease recently and have been too scared to eat out, so it was a HUGE relief to not have to worry about getting sick from my meal.  The food was delicious, the cartel coffee was amazing as always and even my boyfriend (who loves his gluten-filled foods) was a fan.  I will definitely be coming back!!  I'm so grateful that this place exists.

7zGpLOcC3oiiPIVyFN4j1A.text: Thank goodness for this place. All GF with many things that are DF/EF as well. hooray!

Y_M9XIvll1pmXw5W40wLSw.text: Amazing for brunch. Only harm is that they close early. I tried their fruit plate and chicken with waffles. EEverything was do e ad healthy as possible. Even the waffles and chicken were as healthy as they get. Incredible. And the fruit plate was fresh. Tad on the expensive side for brunch but worth it

gQbgeR6SjdbSSE6FGdC-hg.text: Walked in 10 minutes before they stopped serving breakfast. The woman behind the counter was very friendly and sweet. It wasn't until I heard a comment from the cook behind the window about me "being able to order whatever I want off the menu" that made me feel rather uncomfortable seeing as I ordered before they had finished serving breakfast and not to mention i was 1 of 3 people there, so I thought they would have appreciated my business regardless. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was cute. I may be back if I am in the neighborhood.

049riTugghRAeaE57Xsv_Q.text: Searched for bakery close by for my son's Birthday party and found this place. I was so impressed with their cupcakes that we tried! I literally got goosebumps from how good their Caramel Macchiato Cupcake was! That one was my favorite. Also super yummy was their Carrot Cake Cupcake. Love the frosting on that one and the caramel macchiato. All their cupcakes were perfectly moist and also best cupcakes I have ever had! Can't wait to order my son's cake or cupcakes (haven't decided yet) and also try more things off their menu. To be continued.....

sPS6XqNtE_w6NTEpvJj8cw.text: A friend told me about Jewel's knowing I'm always looking for a great gluten free spot to eat. This place is going to be a new favorite. Everything is gluten free! They have a great breakfast and lunch menu, and so many baked treats. I had an amazing gluten free & vegan vanilla almond cupcake. Very excited to have found this bakery/cafe!

DJrGPXT335QgVjTaKI4xiQ.text: Jewel's has always been my favorite safe, gluten free place to eat. I've been coming here for years. The food always has the most flavors and is appealing in photos and in person. Today my daughter and I drove from Flagstaff just to get some tasty brunch and pastries. The "sinna" mon rolls don't disappoint! I also tried the chicken fried steak for the first time and I may have a new favorite. Although the popcorn chicken and mini donuts still holds the top spot! My daughter for the classic fried chicken basket. Jewel's fried chicken is the best I've ever eaten. So tender and juicy. Even for being busy on a Sunday, the service was excellent!!

sEDlfFiX9CTms0IWWqPuMg.text: Bottomless mimosa with a purchase of a meal! Yes please! Their chicken and waffles with the sauces was amazing. We got ours Nashville hot chicken with waffles and it was the perfect blend of hot and sweet. A ton of flavor. The Bloody Mary was a little just tomato soup, but overall wonderful experience!

HzlT9U5bQfbpHi9IhVLlFQ.text: 5 star for the only time I've gone. Got Nashville hot chicken and waffles. It was amazing. Their buttermilk syrup is not like traditional maple, but it was an amazing choice. It's not music bumping bottomless mimosa type of brunch, but I would come here if you're looking for great food on a weekend afternoon (or anytime)

ynWRAlM8H_SDysy2Z1xTRA.text: I was lucky to find this place.  I have Celiac disease the food is amazing.  I felt safe and food is delicious .  Im from New Jersey it is difficult to find a Gluten Free restaurant.  I ate there everyday did not get sick plus the waitress are knowledgeable about  food allergy.  I love it best place for Gluten sensitivity individual.

xNwE2J_ncJeYefRHCRwl1w.text: AVOID!  Used to LOVE this place. Recent large scale changes to menu, ingredient quality, and attention to detail have made this place go from 1st to WORST.   Just another one of those places that decided to go cheap and live off previous reputation.  Such a shame!

62YGSsSsRwOSPt5OLYbq6w.text: Went in. Sat down. Employee informed us that menus were at table and left. No one returned for quite some time. Got up. Left.

DvTrxNn-S8XBQKaCb7b_AQ.text: Cool spot, definitely a restaurant vibe more than a coffee shop. Though Jewel's serves Press Coffee and serves pastries, it reminds me of Matt's Big Breakfast in Downtown Phoenix. I felt a little awkward bringing my backpack in and reading for a little bit as opposed to coming in for breakfast.  GF kitchen and free cookie on check in! Do it!

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan blueberry muffin, very soft and juicy!

Bt0V9R6_fGwxxthSpjm-kQ.text: Really great food, especially being gluten free. We had the spicy chicken and waffles. Great crispy chicken, nice thick waffles and the desert bar had many options. I would love to go back and try some more food.

Rv79eTjoycJJIBbxXlwO5w.text: Best breakfast-Brunch place i have been to since i have moved down here a few months ago.  Small, yet homie, and the staff were super-duper friendly.  Have mentioned yet bottomless mimosa's all day everyday?   But to the food.  I myself ordered the waffle chicken sandwich and i just want to say, my god.  The "dressing" which I'm assuming is syrup of some kind, was delicious and not sticky! My lady had there donuts which were superb as well.    All in highly highly recommend to my fellow Arizonans living in the Arcadia area and afar!

tstmBT23qcsnm61XWt6fsA.text: Be sure to find this Diamond in the Rough!  Jewel's Bakery is popping out some amazing gluten free food.  That is why this is the diamond in the rough.  It is super hard to find food that is gluten free that taste like its not gluten free.  Not only does Jewel's serve gluten free their whole menu is gluten free.  You cannot find that anywhere, or at least I have not come across that and I travel the country every week.  This trendy modern neighborhood cafe can throw down with the best of them.    If you have the word bakery in the name you better have some great baked goods.  Which Jewel's delivers.  They have a great pastry selection that is gluten free and each pastry is fresh, flavorful, and has more selection than your normal bakery.  When we visited Jewel's this is what we recommend, but by all means you cannot go wrong with anything on their menu:  Donuts - Right off that bat you cannot tell that any of these donuts are gluten free.  I actually had to double check with the waitress to make sure.  Mint Chocolate Chip - The donut itself was chewy, and fluffy.  There was a light mint flavor with the chocolate flavor in the back end.  This was a very delicious donut.  The Mint flavor did not over power the donut which is spot on!  Strawberry Shortcake - Same thing.  The donut was chewy, fluffy and could not tell it is gluten free.  From the first bite there was a good strawberry flavor, the sugary crumble adds a nice little crunch, with hint of vanilla flare.  This donut was interesting because the  strawberry flavor takes you back down memory lane.  I could not put my finger on it but I have tasted this flavor before which was a warm welcome to my child hood!  Orange Drumstick - Best gluten free donut I have ever had!  This donut punched you in the mouth!  The nice subtle hint of orange which does not over power the donut and marries well with the white chocolate pieces on top on the back end. VERY soft, chewy inside.  Muffin and Scone  Banana Nut - This muffin was very moist, soft, and chewy.  This reminds me of moms homemade banana walnut bread taste.  You like banana nut bread, just think if that but gluten free!    Chocolate Chip Scone - This scone is for you my chocolate lovers that needs their daily chocolate fix.  This scone has a nice crust on the outside with the nice warm soft chewy inside with big chocolate flavor on the back end.   Breakfast Entrees  Chorizo Breakfast Bowl - This bowl is made with potato, two eggs, cheddar, onion, red pepper, Chorizo, and Chipotle Aioli. This bowl is for you savory people that want a little heat in the morning.  This bowl is very pleasing to the eye and will take you down to flavor town.  This bowl is not also flavorful but has layers of texture for that perfect bowl.  You get the layers of texture with crispness of potato, heat from Chorizo, and fluffiness of eggs topped with Chipotle Aoli and salsa.   Biscuits & Gravy (Favorite) - This entree has sage sausage gravy, fresh baked gluten free biscuits, potatoes, bacon with chicken sausage and eggs.  With first bite you get the flavor in thick, chunky, rich, flavorful, creamy gravy.  Then you get the gravy flavor which gets soaked up into the biscuit for the full flavor at each level.  This dish is served with perfectly seasoned crispy potatoes and nice fluffy eggs.  The gravy is what makes this entree and complements everything nicely.    Chicken & Waffles -  This entree is a money maker.  You get 3 strips of fried chicken with 4 quarter sized waffles served with honey sriracha, and buttermilk syrup.  The chicken has a crispy outside, flavorful batter with nice tender, juicy white meat chicken on the inside.  The waffles were nice, fluffy, chewy and marries well with the chicken for that texture punch to the face.  The waffle soaks up the 2 sauces combined with the chicken make for the a unique perfect bite.  Waffle Breakfast Sandwich - This has Schreiner's sausage, eggs, cheddar, potatoes, and syrup.  The first bite you get the fluffy savory waffle that complements nicely with the juicy chicken sausage (you can see the herbs and spices in the sausage), and the eggs and cheddar on the back end of the bite.  If you want to add another level of flavor you can add a little maple syrup to complete this amazing breakfast sandwich.  Gluten intolerant or not ride your magic carpet down and find this magical Jewel in Phoenix.  BrandonFitFoodie

pPz8HUWtxThlgSrdwotyMw.text: I had the Nashville Hot Chicken and Waffles and loved it! The chicken was amazing! The spice level was right on point and the skin was perfectly crisp. The waffle was cooked to perfection and wasn't dry like a lot of waffles I've tried at restaurants so that was a very welcomed surprise. This is without a doubt the best chicken and waffles I've had in AZ and is one of the top chicken and waffles and Nashville Hot Chicken I've had anywhere. You NEED to come try it if you're a fan of hot chicken and/or chicken and waffles (they have normal chicken and waffles for those that don't like the heat)

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ggr2LthHNzZTXzKibDsslg.text: The cupcakes are pure heaven. I especially love the dark chocolate with espresso icing. They use only local coffee both in the treats and as beverage. Justine the owner knows her stuff and is sweet to boot!

2FR9mwaH2mS9jJSVqrWWCw.text: I stopped by just for a pastry so my review is only about the 2 things I picked up. It was toward the end of the day and there wasnt much left but what I ended up with was a fruity pebble macaron and an apple cake blondie. The macaron was the best I've had. These aren't easy to make, let alone perfect but Jewels has it on lock. The apple crumb cake was divine as well. Nice and moist and you can tell its homemade. I'll definitely come back earlier to try other things!

ePHtbLWwvx29Ndob_wB5tg.text: This is hands down the most underrated place in all of arizona. They advertise as gluten free, but dont let that scare you away! My girlfriend brought me here (she has celiacs) and we dined here and i kid you not, these were the BEST waffles i had. On top of that, the chicken and donuts will make you drool. If i could rate them any higher than 5 i would. Love the place.  Only criticism i have for jewels is if they upped their marketing strategies they could be packed out everyday.

66QE-edZ8OQscabtMg15aA.text: I'm not even exaggerating, this is 100% the BEST place I've been to! Happy Valentine's Day to everyone at Jewels Cafe!

photos.caption: Photo of Jewel's Bakery and Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pictured here in our belly&#39;s the Hot Chicken and Waffles and the Country Fried Chicken and Gravy, the best Valentine&#39;s Day brunch!

oW6nyOrivUr25gCyK9f7DQ.text: Not impressed with the service stood at the front counter the entire time  roughly 15 or more but i was greeted;waiting to buy cupcakes i even used the restroom came back 2 girls were behind the counter and no acknowledgement so i kept waiting and i just ended up walking out. I will never recommend this place nor will i waste my time here again.  Thanks for wasting my time ill go to Berthas instead

mkb0RZIPwnDncLnXz9ZayQ.text: This was our first time here and I have nothing but great things to say about this place! We were greeted as soon as we walked in and our waitress was very attentive and helpful the whole time we were there. We ordered the cheese curds to start and then I ordered the chicken strips basket (I'm a celiac) and my boyfriend ordered the chicken and waffles (he has no dietary restrictions). The cheese curds were nice and very ooey gooey. The chicken was really good with a nice, thick crispy batter to it. Since being diagnosed, I have struggled to find a place with really good, crispy chicken tenders (except for a particular food truck) so I am thrilled that I now know where I can go when I have a craving. The waffles were excellent as well. Very fluffy and moist with a nice texture. Had my boyfriend not been told it was gluten-free he never would've been able to tell just by eating it. Also, their honey maple syrup is oh so good! We also bought a few desserts to go and, at the suggestion of our server, I got the creme brulee macaron. I was also mesmerized by how pretty the blueberry lemon cheesecake looked so I had to get that, too. I wanted to try the cereal thriller blondie but another customer beat me to the last one. Oh well there's always next time. But let me tell you about the ones I did get. The creme brulee macaron was so good. It had a nice sweet flavor and was light and airy. Great recommendation! The cheesecake...oh my...that was like heaven on my fork. Not only was it beautiful (sorry, I ate it before I thought to snap a picture), the taste was amazing! Easily the best cheesecake I've had in a long time. Had I known it was going to be that good, I would've bought the whole cake! There's always next time. ;-) I was also pleasantly surprised with the prices of the desserts.   Overall, great food, great service. It is so nice to have a place with a tasty selection that I know is safe for me to eat. It takes the stress out of dining out. I will definitely be back. Thank you for this gem!

5Xqh8GX4QJPYKeGqlvEgWg.text: I've been going to Jewels for a while now. My husband and I made reservations to treat his parents and my mother to brunch yesterday for Mother's Day. We had previously taken my mom out to Jewels for the past 2 mother's days. I hate to say it, this time was a huge mistake.   Another reviewer mentioned "Mother's Day Chaos", and this described our experience perfectly. We ordered 2 appetizers, chips and churros, along with entrees for all of us. It took quite some time for the apps to come out, but we figured they were busy and we'd just deal with it. The chips came out and we had to ask for our churros again in order to get those. When we got them, the order wasn't complete (we were missing one). We were just happy to have food at that point.  About an hour after we arrived, everyone got their food - except me. It wasn't until everyone was almost done with their food that I finally got my order, after telling 2 people that we were still waiting for it. I'm 7 months pregnant, getting cranky, and my entire family is offering me their sides just so I could have something to eat since I was getting shaky. My father in law asked for a refill on his drink and we got it as he was finishing his meal. I will also mention, that the people next to us were seated some time after us, got their food before us, got their cupcakes, paid, and left - all before we did. This might be stupid, but my in laws drove from Prescott for this, and my mother in law had told me she was excited to try one of the cupcakes... we never got any. I wanted to order some, but it was so crazy that we just ended up leaving.   I'm just disappointed because I wanted this to be a nice day for my mom and my mother in law (and myself, since this is kind of my first Mother's Day, being super pregnant and all) and it honestly just sucked. I think it was just overbooked and that could have been avoided.   Overall - decent food, great pastries, however I will forever avoid events there from now on.

z6uQ1SCx8tsxydswkJzz2w.text: Tried the Chicken and Waffles and split it with my wife.  Chicken is in strips and the waffle is buttermilk. Both were good, did not jump off the page.  Buttermilk Syrup and Honey Sirachha Syrup.  Nice little restauant that seems locally owned with nice touches.
